ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Leaks in CVS HEAD?

stack wrote:
> Tom Emerson wrote:
> 
> 
>>Running a domain-scope crawl (62 seeds) using BDB frontier I'm running
>>out of memory about 48% of the way through. Various vitals:
>>
>>Dual CPU P3, 1G physical memory, running Gentoo 2.6.8-gentoo-r3 kernel.
>>Java 1.5.0-b64.
>>Heritrix 1.3 HEAD, built on 7 Febuary around 11AM EST.
>>
>>The log is full of warning messages like:
>>
>>02/12/2005 09:19:55 +0000 WARNING 
>>org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorHTML innerProcess Failed get of 
>>replay char sequence 
>>CrawlURI(http://mosabeghelaliga.persianblog.com/1383_3_mosabeghelaliga_archive.html) 
>><http://mosabeghelaliga.persianblog.com/1383_3_mosabeghelaliga_archive.html%29> 
>>null ToeThread #22
>>
> 
> Yeah.  We've seen this on occasion.  Odd is how the exception message is 
> 'null' in the above.  I assume you have plenty disk and none of the 
> other logs are throwing IOExceptions anywhere?
> 

The catchall Exception handler in ExtractorHTML.innerProcess() doesn't seem
justified and may be hiding important details; I've removed it from HEAD.

There may be more info in local-errors.log on the causing Exception -- this
log output is accompanied by an exception stored to local-errors.

If by chance the httpRecorder itself is null or corrupt there could also be
other exceptions (in console or local-errors.log) from FetchHTTP that are
the cause.

- Gordon @ IA
